div.p: The authority title list draws on a spine catalogue of Prokofiev compositions created for this resource. Combining earlier Prokofiev catalogues with current scholarship, this resource allows users to search for a work in the language (Russian, French, German, or English) of its original manuscript or published title. A uniform title for each work binds variant titles together under one entry.

img.alt: PCDA works authorities index with related archival content

div.p: Standard catalogue information, such as genre, instrumentation and date of composition, are linked to works that share these components. User may search by each field – genre, instrumentation, date, among others – to collate works that share features. 'Offshoot' works, such as arrangements, adaptations and works rooted in the same material, receive independent entries while representing their relation to other compositions in Prokofiev's output. For a sample catalogue entry click here.

Prokofiev's rigorous methods of composition often allow an archaeological context for works to emerge. The list of manuscripts under each entry represents, usually incompletely, different phases of conception as the work progressed from abstract sketch to complete autograph score. Manuscript types include: sketch of 'germ' themes (melodic and rhythmic); sketches identifiably linked to a work; draft short score; elaborated draft short score; draft score with scoring indicated; autograph score; complete score created by copyist. Letters linked to each entry provided vital testimony to the genesis of compositions.

The Prokofiev Catalogue and Digital Archive digitally captures crucial sketches, catalogues, scores and letters relating to Prokofiev's compositions that are housed in the Prokofiev Archive. These sources are linked to the relevant work catalogue entries. Attached to each digitized item are transcriptions, translations and information about the item's provenance; this metadata sheds light on how digitized primary sources relate to a work.
